title: Chelsea defender Kurt Zouma refuses to rule out summer move after frustrating season
text:
Kurt Zouma has only made eight appearances under Chelsea boss Antonio Conte (Picture: Getty) Chelsea defender Kurt Zouma has refused to rule out a summer departure after a frustrating season at Stamford Bridge.
The Frenchman, who joined the Blues in 2014 from Saint-Etienne, has only played eight games for Antonio Conte this term.
Arsenal legend speaks out on replacing Wenger as boss this summer Only four of those outings have come in the Premier League, with Italian boss Conte favouring a back-three featuring David Luiz, Gary Cahill and Cesar Azpilicueta throughout the campaign.
Zouma is under contract with Chelsea until the summer of 2019 but the 22-year-old says he will evaluate his future at the end of the season.
‘Leaving Chelsea? We’ll see at the end of the season,’ Zouma said when asked about his future by beIN Sports .
French centre-back Zouma joined the Blues three years ago (Picture: Getty) More: Football Antonio Conte prepared to reject record-breaking transfer offers for Chelsea star

Despite storming 10 points clear at the top of the Premier League, Conte is refusing to rest on his laurels and intends to bolster his squad in the summer.
The ex-Italy boss has reportedly told Blues owner Roman Abramovich of his desire to bring Real Madrid striker Alvaro Morata to west London.
Alvaro Morata has emerged as a target for Premier League frontrunners Chelsea (Picture: Getty) Antonio Conte worked with striker Morata at Juventus (Picture: Getty) Morata, 24, is struggling for game-time under French legend Zinedine Zidane in the Spanish capital and is said to be open to a reunion with the manager he worked with at Juventus.
